DataElement.preferredName: Within Recipient Or Autologous Graft Neoplastic Cell Prior Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation Detected Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not tumor cells were detected in the recipient or autologous product prior to the hematopoietic cell transplantation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Within Recipient Or Autologous Graft Neoplastic Cell Prior Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation Detected
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: On the inside; contained in._A person who gets something._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._(aw-TAHL-o-gus) Taken from an individual's own tissues, cells, or DNA._Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body._Cells of, or derived from, a tumor._Earlier in time or order._Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)._The replacement of tissue with tissue from the person's own body or from another person._Detected; perceived or discerned.

Concepts.definition: On the inside; contained in.
A person who gets something.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Taken from an individual's own tissues, cells, or DNA.
Tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient.
Cells of, or derived from, a tumor.

Property.preferredName: Prior Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Detected
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.):The grafting of tissues from one individual to another or place to place within a single individual.:Detected; perceived or discerned.

Concepts.definition: Earlier in time or order.

Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)
Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.
Detected; perceived or discerned.

AlternateNames.name: Within Recipient Or Autologous Graft Neoplastic Cell Prior Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Detected Indicator

ReferenceDocuments.name: Were tumor cells detected in
ReferenceDocuments.description: Were tumor cells detected in the recipient or autologous product prior to HCT?

ReferenceDocuments.name: BRIDG mapping path for CDE:2749698
ReferenceDocuments.description: "[IF EXISTS THEN ""true"" ELSE ""false""] PerformedClinicalResult.value(ANY=>BL)  =""true"" WHERE PerformedClinicalResult > PerformedObservation > DefinedObservation.nameCode = ""test for tumor cells"" AND PerformedObservation.dateRange IS LESS THAN {date of transplant} AND (PerformedObservation > Subject > Person > Subject > PerformedSubstanceAdministration > DefinedSubstanceAdministration.nameCode = ""Administer Hematopoietic Stem Cell Product{transplantation}""     OR PerformedObservation > Subject > Biologic > PerformedSubstanceExtraction > SubstanceExtractionAdministrationRelationship.relationCode = ""autologous"")  {date of transplant} is determiend by: Subject > PerformedSubstanceAdministration.dateRange WHERE PerformedSubstanceAdministration > DefinedSubstanceAdministration.nameCode = ""Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplant"""

DataElement.changeDescription: .2021-2-23 ak OK to release per WZ. System generated def displayed as alt def.
